# Waridashi Station

is a railway station on the Hokuriku Railroad Asanogawa Line in the city of Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan, operated by the private railway operator Hokuriku Railroad (Hokutetsu).
Lines
Waridashi Station is served by the 6.7 km Hokuriku Railroad Asanogawa Line between  and , and is located 2.8 kilometers from Kanazawa Station.
Station layout
The station consists of one side platform serving a single bi-directional track. The station is unattended.
Adjacent stations
|next=}}
History
Waridashi Station opened on 10 May 1925.
Surrounding area
* Hokuriku Railroad Headquarters
* Asanogawa Junior High School
* Matsudera Bridge
* Hokuriku Expressway
